abstract: <jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:p>The <jats:italic>Rheotanytarsus guineensis</jats:italic> species group (Diptera: Chironomidae) is a species diverse and taxonomically difficult group. Using DNA barcodes, we found five new species within the <jats:italic>R</jats:italic>. <jats:italic>guineensis</jats:italic> species group and reviewed the species group based on adult males from China. <jats:italic>Rheotanytarsus guoae</jats:italic> Lin & Yao <jats:bold>sp. n</jats:bold>., <jats:italic>Rheotanytarsus miaoae</jats:italic> Lin & Yao <jats:bold>sp. n</jats:bold>., <jats:italic>Rheotanytarsus qiangi</jats:italic> Lin & Yao <jats:bold>sp. n</jats:bold>., <jats:italic>Rheotanytarsus yueqingensis</jats:italic> Lin & Yao <jats:bold>sp. n</jats:bold>., and <jats:italic>Rheotanytarsus yui</jats:italic> Lin & Yao <jats:bold>sp. n</jats:bold>. are all described and figured. A key to known adult males of the <jats:italic>R</jats:italic>. <jats:italic>guineensis</jats:italic> species group worldwide is provided for the first time.</jats:p>
title: DNA barcodes and morphology reveal new species within the Rheotanytarsus guineensis species group from China (Diptera: Chironomidae)
